div.l: Suche as he fynde or take suche as he brynges
But specially I preye þe oste der͗e
¶ Gete us som mete and drynke and make us cher͗e
And we woll paien̄ trewly at þe full
With empty handes men̄ may non̄ hawkes tull
Loo her͗e our͗e siluer redy for to spende
This myller to þe towne his doȝht̉er sende
For ale and brede and rosted hem a goose
And bonde hir͗e hors it schuld no mor͗e go loose
And in his own̄ chambre he made a bedde
With schetes and with chalons fair͗e y spredde
Noȝt from his owne bedde · x · fete of twelfe
His doȝht̉er had a bedde all be her͗e selue
Riȝht in þe same chambr͗e by and by
It myȝht be no better and cause why
Ther was no rowmer herber in þat place
Þei soupen̄ and speken̄ hem to solace
And drynken̄ euer stronge ale at þe beste
A boute mydde nyȝht wente þei to reste
Wele hath þis meller͗e vernysshed his hede
Fule pale he was for dronken and not rede
He ȝexith and he spekith thurgh þe noose
As he war͗e in þe quakke or in þe pose
To bedde he goith and with hym goith his wyffe
As any Iay he was liȝht and Iolyffe
So was hir͗e Ioly whistell wele y wette
The credell at hir͗e beddes fete is y sette
To rokken̄ and to ȝiff þe childe to souke
And whan̄ þat dronken̄ was al in þe crouke
To bedde wente þe doght̉er riȝht onoon̄
To bedde goith Aleyn̄ and also Iohn
Ther nas no mor͗e / þam neded no dwale
This myller͗e hath so wysly bibbed good ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taille be hynde he toke no kepe
His wiff bar͗e hym a burdon̄ a full stronge
Men̄ myȝhten̄ her͗e her routynge wel a furlonge
The wenche rowteth eke pur compaygnye
Aleyn̄ þe clerke þat harde þis melodye
He powked Iohn and seide slepist þowe
Herdest þou eủer slike a songe ar͗e or nowe
Loo swiche a cowplynge is betwene hem alle
A wilde fir͗e on þeir bodies fall
Who herkened euer suche a ferly thynge
Ȝa þei schall haue þe flour͗e of euyll endynge
¶ This longe nyȝht þer tides me no reste
But ȝit na force all schall be for þe beste
